acqinfo.p: The ciollection of Robbins printed materials was assemble form a variety of sources. NO.

accruals.p: No further additions to the collection expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Frank E. Robbins reprints, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Frank E. Robbins was a University of Michigan professor and assistant to the president/

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of pamphlets and reprints of writings authored by Frank E. Robbins. The individual items were gathered from different sources.

did.unittitle: Chronology and history in Trollope's Barset and parliamentary novels. (Nineteenth-Century Fiction), March, 1951
The cost to Athens of her second empire. (Classical Philology), October, 1918
The creation story in Ovid Met.i. (Classical Philology), October, 1913
Mathematical fragments, 143, Euclid, Elements I, Definitions 1-10., third century
Astrological fragments, 148, Fragment of an anonymous treatise, plate IV, first century
Murder at Manistee. (The Quarterly Review), undated
A new astrological treatise: Michigan papyrus no. 1. (Classical Philology), January, 1927
P. Mich. 620: A series of arithmetical problems. (Classical Philology), October, 1929
Pickwickian chronology. (Bibliographical Society of America papers), 1924
Posidonius and the sources of Pythagorean arithmology. (Classical Philology), October, 1920
The relation between codices B and F of Pliny's letters. (Classical Philology), October, 1910
Some statistics of Greek verb forms. (The Classical Journal), November 1919
The tradition of Greek arithmology. (Classical Philology), April, 1921
